model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Husband: I hung up some more lights and candles today.

[MEMORY]
User Description:
Husband is a man who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly cherishing the connections he has with them. He is passionate about his faith and values close relationships. Husband is grateful for his Christian upbringing and finds support in his faith community. He also appreciates the little things in life that make him feel happy and content.

Relationship Description:
Husband and Wife have a supportive and understanding relationship. Wife supports Husband in his faith journey and appreciates the importance of cherishing connections in life. They have open communication and share their thoughts and experiences with each other.

Event Description:
- Husband had a great time hanging out with his friend, discussing ideas for a new project they might work on together.
- Husband made it just in time to catch the bus, feeling an adrenaline rush, while Wife doesn't like rushing.
- Husband is thinking about creating a podcast with his friend and is looking forward to working on the project.
- Husband practices guitar playing and feels he is improving, with Wife being supportive and suggesting he plays new songs for her.
- Husband remembers being baptized at eight years old and is grateful for his Christian upbringing. Wife supports him in his faith journey.
